title: Donald Trump withdraws support for Marjorie Taylor Greene | ABC NEWS
description: The US President Donald Trump has withdrawn his support from firebrand conservative congresswoman Marjorie Taylor Greene. Greene was among a handful of Republican lawmakers who joined Democrats calling for the release of files related to Jeffrey Epstein. title: Severe storms hit Queensland and NSW with giant hail and flash flooding | ABC NEWS
description: Some parts of Queensland and NSW received 80mm of rain in an hour while other areas reported giant hail as severe thunderstorms struck the east coast. Angus Hines from the Bureau of Meteorology says, while the worst of the storms are over, some sodden catchments could see further localised heavy falls. title: Dementia now the leading cause of death in Australia | ABC NEWS
description: Dementia has overtaken heart disease as the leading cause of death in Australia, with the number of deaths caused by dementia up 39% over the past decade. Kaarin Anstey from UNSW says an aging population and better treatment of cardiovascular health is behind the change. title: AFP charge three people over alleged $71 million Defence contracts fraud | ABC NEWS
description: Three Northern Territory residents have been arrested and charged with fraud, and one of them also with corruption over an alleged multi-million-dollar Defence contract scheme. Australian Federal Police (AFP) investigators raided homes and businesses across Darwin on Friday after receiving a tip-off from the Department of Defence about the alleged crime. The AFP alleges a 48-year-old Commonwealth Defence employee, his 40-year-old wife, and a 41-year-old male director of a local construction firm had conspired to channel nearly $71 million of Defence building contracts to their own company. During the raids, investigators seized $30,000 in cash, documents, electronic devices, jewellery and a small quantity of illicit drugs, which the AFP suspects is cocaine. In a statement, the AFP alleged that the group "were involved in a conspiracy to influence the awarding of tenders to their company, with the intention of dishonestly gaining a benefit from the Commonwealth, namely the Department of Defence". By Felicity James for ABC News Northern Territory. title: Croc owners welcome government crackdown on Territorian’s best friend | ABC NEWS
description: Under the Northern Territory government's proposed new crocodile ownership rules, pet owners would be charged a $299 permit fee for the privilege. If the plan goes ahead, croc owners would also face $300 fines if their pets escape, plus another $100 for each hour the reptile remains on the loose. Attorney-General Marie-Clare Boothby said the government wanted to "ensure there is responsible crocodile ownership" in the NT, where 63 residents are currently licensed to own pet crocs. The plan also includes a requirement for new owners to have their animals undergo a procedure to receive identification markings, as well as upgrades to enclosure standards. By Matt Garrick for ABC News Northern Territory. title: Spectators injured after car rams into crowd at country showground | ABC NEWS
description: A car crashed into spectators at a motor rally in the regional New South Wales town of Walcha on Saturday night, critically injuring one person and sending 12 others to the hospital. Spectators administered first aid before NSW Ambulance paramedics transported nine individuals to Walcha District Hospital, with four expected to be transferred to major hospitals. title: Coalition says their new climate policy is based on economics, not science | ABC NEWS
description: The Coalition has finalised its net zero policy position, including that it would reduce emissions "year on year," considering the "real performance" of other developed countries.  It comes days after the Liberal Party agreed to drop its commitment to net zero, bringing the party in line with its junior partner.
